item.title: Spring 2026 School of Engineering Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 25, 2026 (all day) - Spring 2026 School of Engineering (SoE) Midterm course evaluations are now open. Your feedback is very important to the Institute and the school, so please complete the SoE midterm evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Friday, March 13, 2026.

item.title: 2026 Spring Interfaith Lecture
item.description: Join us for a meaningful evening of insight and conversation as Rabbi Reena Judd shares reflections on love, family, and belonging. Rabbi Judd will read selections from her book of contemporary midrashim, offering thoughtful perspectives rooted in tradition and resonant with modern life.

item.title: Webinar Friday February 27: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System
item.description: Join Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, on Friday February 27 from 11am to 12pm, for a live webinar introducing Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management System. Discover how to access campus‑wide photography, multimedia files, and institutional assets—all in one place. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700

item.title: Accepted Student Celebrations – Undergraduate Admissions
item.description: The Office of Undergraduate Admissions will host two Accepted Student Celebrations this spring - Saturday, March 21 and Saturday, April 11. We look forward to celebrating with admitted students and their families and highlighting how an RPI education will prepare them to change the world. If you or a campus organization you are part of would like to volunteer during the event, please contact Arianna Livshits, Senior Event Planner, at paluma3@rpi.edu.

item.title: RPI at Work Information Session on February 27
item.description: Date: Friday, February 27, 2026 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - RPI at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., will be reviewing the online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Please RSVP if you plan to attend and learn more about RPI at Work.

item.title: Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review with RPI at Work
item.description: Date: Thursday, March 5, 2026 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - This 30-minute information session is hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., and will focus on RPI’s Systems Engineering & Technology Management graduate degree. The degree is digitally delivered, flexible, and project-based to prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. The session will highlight program details and how you can select graduate certificates relevant to your work to complete…

item.title: Upcoming closures in Shuttle services
item.description: Friendly reminder that shuttles do not operate on holidays or during University closures. In observance of Spring Break (February 28–March 7), shuttles will not be running. Please plan accordingly.

item.title: McKinney Contest Award Ceremony to be held April 9
item.description: The 2026 Annual McKinney Reading Series and Student Awards Ceremony will take place on Thursday, April 9, 2026, from 7:00–9:00 p.m. at the Heffner Alumni House. The event will feature Hisham Matar, the Pulitzer Prize–winning author of three novels and two memoirs. The evening will include the announcement of the McKinney Student Writing Contest winners, a literary reading, and an audience Q&A, followed by a book signing. Books will be available for purchase at the event.

item.description: Did you know that you can easily book online a small group tutoring session in many of RPI’s upper-level courses? Check out the fantastic small group tutoring sessions being offered at the Success Center!

item.description:
Thank you everyone for sending proposed names for our new AI Phishing Coach! After team vote, we have narrowed our selection down to the top three choices: bAIt and tackle, Phishing Net, and PhishStick. Please click above link to vote for your favorite name! Voting will close on Monday, March 2nd.
